form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mrs. Feinstein (for herself, Mr. Schumer, Mr. Whitehouse, Mrs. Boxer, Mr. Menendez, and Mr. Lautenberg) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To establish and clarify that Congress does not authorize persons convicted of dangerous crimes in foreign courts to freely possess firearms in the United States.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the No Firearms for Foreign Felons Act of 2013.

paragraph.text: Section 921(a) of title 18, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:
The term any court includes any Federal, State, or foreign court.
Section 921(a)(20) of title 18, United States Code, is amended—

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (B), by striking any State offense classified by the laws of the State and inserting any State or foreign offense classified by the laws of that jurisdiction; and

in the matter following subparagraph (B), in the first sentence, by inserting before the period the following: , except that a foreign conviction shall not constitute a conviction of such a crime if the convicted person establishes that the foreign conviction resulted from a denial of fundamental fairness that would violate due process if committed in the United States or from conduct that would be legal if committed in the United States.

subsection.text: Section 921(a)(33) of title 18, United States Code, is amended—

subparagraph.text: in the matter preceding clause (i), by striking subparagraph (C) and inserting subparagraph (B); and

clause.text: by striking and and inserting or; and
by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (B)(ii), by striking if the conviction has and inserting the following:

subclause.text: occurred in a foreign jurisdiction and the convicted person establishes that the foreign conviction resulted from a denial of fundamental fairness that would violate due process if committed in the United States or from conduct that would be legal if committed in the United States; or

subsection.text: Section 924(e)(2)(A)(ii) of title 18, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking an offense under State law and inserting an offense under State or foreign law; and

by inserting before the semicolon the following: , except that a foreign conviction shall not constitute a conviction of such a crime if the convicted person establishes that the foreign conviction resulted from a denial of fundamental fairness that would violate due process if committed in the United States or from conduct that would be legal if committed in the United States.
